Function.desc: Displays a keyboard hints for switching focus to each window
stripped_doc: Displays a keyboard hints for switching focus to each window
Function.doc:
Displays a keyboard hints for switching focus to each window

Parameters:
 * windows - An optional table containing some `hs.window` objects. If this value is nil, all windows will be hintsed
 * callback - An optional function that will be called when a window has been selected by the user. The function will be called with a single argument containing the `hs.window` object of the window chosen by the user
 * allowNonStandard - An optional boolean.  If true, all windows will be included, not just standard windows

Returns:
 * None

Notes:
 * If there are more windows open than there are characters available in Hints.hintChars, multiple characters will be used
 * If Hints.style is set to "vimperator", every window hints is prefixed with the first character of the parent application's name
 * To display Hints only for the currently focused application, try something like:
  * `Hints:windowHints(hs.window.focusedWindow():application():allWindows())`
notes: * If there are more windows open than there are characters available in Hints.hintChars, multiple characters will be used
* If Hints.style is set to "vimperator", every window hints is prefixed with the first character of the parent application's name
* To display Hints only for the currently focused application, try something like:
Function.name: windowHints
parameters: * windows - An optional table containing some `hs.window` objects. If this value is nil, all windows will be hintsed

* callback - An optional function that will be called when a window has been selected by the user. The function will be called with a single argument containing the `hs.window` object of the window chosen by the user
* allowNonStandard - An optional boolean.  If true, all windows will be included, not just standard windows

Variable.desc: This controls the set of characters that will be used for window obj. They must be characters found in hs.keycodes.map
stripped_doc: This controls the set of characters that will be used for window obj. They must be characters found in hs.keycodes.map
The default is the letters A-Z. Note that if `obj.style` is set to "vimperator", this variable will be ignored.
Variable.doc:
This controls the set of characters that will be used for window obj. They must be characters found in hs.keycodes.map
The default is the letters A-Z. Note that if `obj.style` is set to "vimperator", this variable will be ignored.
Variable.name: hintChars

Variable.desc: If this is set to "vimperator", every window hints starts with the first character
stripped_doc: If this is set to "vimperator", every window hints starts with the first character
of the parent application's title
Variable.doc:
If this is set to "vimperator", every window hints starts with the first character
of the parent application's title
Variable.name: style

Variable.desc: A fully specified family-face name, preferrably the PostScript name, such as Helvetica-BoldOblique or Times-Roman. (The Font Book app displays PostScript names of fonts in the Font Info panel.)
stripped_doc: A fully specified family-face name, preferrably the PostScript name, such as Helvetica-BoldOblique or Times-Roman. (The Font Book app displays PostScript names of fonts in the Font Info panel.)
The default value is the system font
Variable.doc:
A fully specified family-face name, preferrably the PostScript name, such as Helvetica-BoldOblique or Times-Roman. (The Font Book app displays PostScript names of fonts in the Font Info panel.)
The default value is the system font
Variable.name: fontName

Variable.desc: The size of font that should be used. A value of 0.0 will use the default size.
stripped_doc: The size of font that should be used. A value of 0.0 will use the default size.
Variable.doc: The size of font that should be used. A value of 0.0 will use the default size.
Variable.name: fontSize

Variable.desc: If there are less than or equal to this many windows on screen their titles will be shown in the obj.
stripped_doc: If there are less than or equal to this many windows on screen their titles will be shown in the obj.
The default is 4. Setting to 0 will disable this feature.
Variable.doc:
If there are less than or equal to this many windows on screen their titles will be shown in the obj.
The default is 4. Setting to 0 will disable this feature.
Variable.name: showTitleThresh

Variable.desc: If the title is longer than maxSize, the string is truncated, -1 to disable, valid value is >= 6
stripped_doc: If the title is longer than maxSize, the string is truncated, -1 to disable, valid value is >= 6
Variable.doc: If the title is longer than maxSize, the string is truncated, -1 to disable, valid value is >= 6
Variable.name: titleMaxSize
